Horror, starring Jay Hernandez, Derek Richardson and Eythor Gudjonsson

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Nigeria (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the fifth last-16 match at Lang Park in Brisbane, Australia. England topped their group with a 100 per cent record, labouring to 1-0 wins over Haiti and Denmark, before finding their best form in their final match with an emphatic 6-1 victory over China. Nigeria finished second in Group B after goalless draws with Canada and Republic of Ireland either side of a shock 3-2 victory over Australia

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Denmark (Kick-off 11.30am). Coverage of the sixth last-16 match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney. Despite a defeat at the hands of Nigeria in their second match, victories over Republic of Ireland and Canada gave the co-hosts top spot in Group B, while Denmark finished second in Group D after wins against China and Haiti either side of a loss to England

How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.title: Dom Does America

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: France v Morocco (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the eighth and concluding last-16 match, which takes place at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. A record of two wins and one draw was enough to see France secure top spot in Group F ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama. Morocco looked unlikely qualifiers after losing their opener 6-0 against Germany, but wins against Korea Republic and group-winners Colombia saw them remarkably finish ahead of the Germans in second place

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton catches up with two house hunters who have moved to Dumfries and Galloway, including a buyer from 2019 whose literary ambitions have come to fruition

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. Dominic Chinea gets to work on an ingenious artist's tool from the 1920s and toy repairers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell give some TLC to a baby seal that is no longer very furry

programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing £7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans restore a vintage toy car that has reached the end of the road, a legal eagle's briefcase and a scrapbook charting the career of an amateur 1930s footballer

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville turn the spotlight on the big name holiday companies viewers say are letting them down. Plus, Simon Calder with advice on how to save money while sightseeing

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets through to Ben after finding him in a terrible state at the Boxing Den. Whitney and Zack have a difficult conversation while Sonia and Reiss have a heart-to-heart. Patrick ponders the future

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1930s pinball machine, an antique weather device and a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. They set up their pop-up auction at the Avoncroft Museum of Historic Buildings in hope of finding the right bidders for John's collection. Carol plans to use any profits to renovate a memorial spot in her garden

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, with the reds and the blue teams being guided by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. During the contest, Natasha learns about the history of wristwatches, and checks out a seriously valuable collection

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader heads to the medieval Tuscan town of Barga, where more than half the locals have Scottish connections. Staying in a mansion that's now a Glaswegian-run B&B, Clive finds out why Italians love a fish supper, helps cook dinner for 14 and joins an expedition to discover the forgotten quartz quarry that helped make Tuscany's capital Florence so beautiful

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey from the Midlands to the West Country, beginning in Derby, where he visits the city's famous 19th-century railway works. In Leicester he looks back to the early 1970s, when around 10,000 Asians arrived in the city after being expelled from Uganda by the dictator Idi Amin. He also hears how meat rationing during the Second World War led to the birth of Walkers crisps, still produced in the city

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: From statues to cascades and an 18th-century bath house, John Craven is at Wrest Park in Bedfordshire to help with an ambitious 20-year restoration project to breathe new life into features that reflect fashions across three centuries. It's also the perfect place for John to dip into the Countryfile archives, including the time Ellie Harrison helped to spruce up the Cerne Abbas Giant, Anita Rani mucked in to clear a toxic scrapyard in Shropshire, and Matt Baker rolled up his sleeves to help restore a 12th-century church in Herefordshire

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood spends 24 hours sampling some of the US's most dangerous and demanding jobs, beginning by working as a correctional officer in a Texas jail

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Trading Standards Officers investigate a driving school after hundreds of learners did not got the lessons they had paid for. Plus, the hunt for a Covid fraudster

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Crewe, Cheshire to see a two-bed end terrace, bought by a theatre nurse to renovate for her son and granddaughter to live in. Martel Maxwell heads to Hull to see a three-bed mid-terrace, where ivy has made its way from the outside in. Plus, cameras return to a three-storey building in Lower Gornal, West Midlands, that Dion first saw in 2018. It had planning permission to convert into two flats, but has it yet to be finished?

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams look for items at the Newark Antiques Fair in Nottinghamshire, while Charlie Ross finds out about the legacy of a local woman

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys presents another heat of the quiz, where contenders take the famous black chair under the glare of the spotlight and the ticking clock. Tonight's specialist subjects are Mammals of the British Isles, Friends, Damien Hirst and the Wimbledon Men's Singles Championship 1968 to 2021

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Short
programme.desc: Simon King and David Myers take a trip through Romania, where they visit the imposing Corvin Castle and cook pork sarmales by the drawbridge

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of day five of the competition, featuring the BMX freestyle park finals in Glasgow. British hopes include 22-year-old Kieran Reilly, who last year became the first person to complete a triple flair - three aerial somersaults on his bike after launching from a ramp. In the women's event, 27-year-old Charlotte Worthington is the reigning Olympic champion, clinching gold in Tokyo after becoming the first woman in history to land a competitive 360-degree backflip

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Cheesemakers Allison and Jonathan and rapeseed oil farmers Olly and Francesca head to Barnard Castle Farmers' Market, County Durham, to try and secure a successful day's takings

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Highland cattle farmer Annie and Pygmy Goat farmer Tanya take their animals to Gloucestershire to compete in the Moreton-in-Marsh Show with some surprising results

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A journey around the region, examining the challenges currently facing the nations in the area. Simon begins in Malta, uncovering the country's reputation for organised crime, before moving on to the southern coast of Italy, where he joins police officers exploring underground tunnels used by crime bosses on the run. Finally, he arrives in Albania and discovers an ancient tradition of revenge where children can pay the price for their parents' actions

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as the Thrifters take on the Suncatchers. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Rise (v), Sufficiently (adv), Healthy (adj), and Hole containing water (n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the fourth of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Southampton pit their wits against a team from Christ Church, Oxford in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Amol Rajan asks the questions

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines how when the Earth first formed from clouds of dust and gas 4.6 billion years ago, it was - like so many other lifeless worlds in the universe - devoid of an atmosphere, an inhospitable rock floating in the black void of space. However, as the young planet was pummelled by asteroids, a period of extraordinary upheaval began

programme.title: Victoria Wood as Seen on TV
programme.desc: Comedy sketches, featuring the cancellation of Acorn Antiques, a visit to a tattoo parlour and a waitress having trouble serving soup to two customers. Starring Victoria Wood, Julie Walters, Celia Imrie and Duncan Prestion. First aired in 1986

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Entebbe (2018)
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller inspired by the 1976 hijacking of a plane by terrorists, chronicling negotiations for the release of the hostages on board and the ultimate decision to send in a crack force of Israeli commandos. Starring Daniel Bruhl, Rosamund Pike and Eddie Marsan

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson are in the thick of hay-making season, discovering what makes one of the nation's oldest crops so special. Charlotte is put to work on the Lizard Peninsula in Cornwall by a farmer whose family have been making hay for more than 500 years and also gets the chance to see how harvest activity attracts and excites myriad creatures. Adam is at a polo match finding out how nutrients in high-end hay are helping horse owners to get ahead, and Tom Heap investigates how marine heatwaves are threatening the sea life that lives around our coastline

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford set out on the trail of the QR codes that led people to pay for more than they bargained for. Plus, the holiday company that appeared totally trustworthy, only for looks to prove deceptive

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: A vet finds something trapped in the intestines of Bear the lost dog. Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case and becomes convinced there was a second killer

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from Saturday Kitchen

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of how plant life turned Earth from a barren rock into a vibrant green world - a 4.5 billion-year saga of extraordinary highs and lows that almost wiped out all life. He reveals how a giant asteroid bombardment triggered Earth's plate tectonics, leading to huge fungi, soil and giant swamp forests, but the early plants locked in so much carbon dioxide that global temperatures suddenly plunged

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The cases of a company selling fake devices that supposedly reduce a car's toxic emissions, and a company that falsely claimed they could reduce customers' heating bills

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef reveals the Cornwall that he knows and loves, championing the food, history, music, art and culture of the county

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ochuko Ojiri and Jonathan Pratt help two teams scour an antiques fair at the National Botanic Garden of Wales in Carmarthenshire, while presenter Eric Knowles visits a rugby union club to see a collection of sporting footwear memorabilia

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest matches, including Wigan Warriors v Hull Kingston Rovers, Hull FC v Wakefield Trinity, and Salford Red Devils v St Helens

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of the Mongol invasions, the plays of Aristophanes, the rise of the East India Company, and Broadway musicals of the 1940s and 1950s, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw makes over Susan and Brian Duthie's new-build garden in Cove, Aberdeenshire, transforming their tiny site from the nightmare of rough builder's rubble

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The South West chefs serve up their music-themed mains and desserts to veteran Daniel Clifford, aiming to secure a place at Friday's judges' chamber. Emily Scott's Bowie-inspired dish celebrates Britain's food heroes and uses Cornish duck meat from her local producer. The Police are Joe Baker's inspiration for his dessert Message in a Bottle, which includes chamomile ice-cream made from Jersey milk along with granola and fennel pollen meringue, and Lee Smith hopes to impress the judges with the complexity of his Beatles-inspired Strawberry Fields dish

programme.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
programme.desc: Chris Packham features animals that utilise devious tactics to win a mate and raise a family, such as bower birds and fiddler crabs, who use optical illusions to impress a female, and male topi antelope, who fake danger to give them an edge. He also looks at family life, including the chicks that blackmail their parents, and the honeyguide bird that dupes another species into raising its young

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo trawls through the National Archives at Kew in south-west London to dig out stories from previously classified documents. In the first episode, he unearths the secret files of Britain's last hangman, explores private letters sent to Sherlock Holmes, and examines the hidden history of murderer Dr Crippen

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of day six of the annual World Track Championships at the Sir Chris Hoy Velodrome in Glasgow, including the men's 1km time trial. Dutchman Jeffrey Hoogland is the defending champion, with last year's victory giving him his seventh World Championship gold medal. France's Melvin Landerneau took silver, with Spaniard Alejandro Martinez claiming bronze. Plus, the best of the action from the team time trial mixed relay road event

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon explores the eastern Mediterranean, beginning in Cyprus, where he goes on patrol with UN peacekeepers overseeing an abandoned buffer zone. He moves on to Lebanon, where he discovers the roots of Christianity, and Israel, where he boards a navy vessel guarding the country's offshore oil reserves. Finally, he crosses the world's most heavily fortified borders into Gaza, where he meets a woman helping reconstruction efforts by making bricks into ash

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Fiona and Andy moved into their 300-year-old Solihull barn conversion a year ago, but it's not quite the fairy tale they imagined. The barn has a major identity crisis - with dated decor, a dark and poky stable conversion, a cut-off central courtyard and a 1980s extension tacked on the end. To add to their woes there's a spiral staircase right in the middle of the living room. Enter architects Laura Jane Clark and Julian McIntosh, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Reality challenge in which eight aspiring wedding planners battle it out to become the best in the business, with six brave couples letting them take control of their big day. The competition gets off to an explosive start as the planners transform an industrial Concorde hangar under the watchful eyes of judges Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya

programme.title: The Omid Djalili Show
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy covering topics including multi-tasking mothers and inter-racial marriages. Sketches feature the aspiring actor, another visit to the confused world of the Mafia Boss and a football yob who contradicts assumptions about his behaviour by hugging unsuspecting members of the public

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Clemency (2019)
programme.desc: American prison warden Bernadine Williams has presided over a dozen executions. However, as the 13th looms, she grapples with complex emotions while bonding with a death-row inmate who maintains his innocence. Writer/director Chinonye Chukwu's drama, starring Alfre Woodard, Richard Schiff, Danielle Brooks and Michael O'Neill

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn is forging a new identity for herself in New York, but when news breaks that she plans to create her own production company, Darryl Zanuck refuses to let her out of her contract. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: In the final part of the series, Marilyn triumphs in her most celebrated comedy yet, Some Like It Hot. In the weeks before her death, she is on the cusp of a new and exciting future, making front pages with her portraits, and securing a triumphant new deal with 20th Century Fox. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: How the lies of a factory worker claiming £90,000 for an accident at work were exposed when his bosses revealed he wasn't even on site. Plus, the driver who tried to get away with claiming for old damage to his car after a minor bump with a lorry is caught on camera and the cabbie who concocted a claim after a prang before being told to cough up thousands by a judge

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle return to Longleat where a tiger is preparing to leave for an international breeding programme - but first needs a thorough health check

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Homer's Odyssey, The Good Life, the history of Portsmouth, and Taika Waititi, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists head to Chester, where the buyer wants something to mark her 10th year of singing in an award-winning choir. With £500 on offer, will it be a glass maker who works on a barge, a collage artist who re-works magazines, or a textile worker of wool who makes the buyer's day? Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals (Start-time 3.00pm). Live coverage of the women's match from Kia Oval, London. Suzie Bates top-scored for the Invincibles when these teams last met, with an unbeaten innings of 79 guiding her side to a 32-run victory at Old Trafford

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals (Start-time 6.30pm). Live coverage of the men's match from Kia Oval, London. Last year's match saw Sam Billings top-score for the Invincibles with 53 runs from 33 deliveries, but Wayne Madsen's unbeaten knock, also worth 53 runs, enabled the Originals to claim a six-wicket victory with a ball to spare

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Roisin Conaty, Jessica Fostekew and Alan Davies take part in the quiz, as Sandi Toksvig asks questions based on a theme of 'Senses'

programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents the quiz, with panellists Hugh Dennis, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Sean McLoughlin and Glenn Moore. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Newsnight

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: With the help of her peers, Dr Orna Guralnik shifts her methods with Sean and Erica, while Brock reveals a childhood wound. Nadine and Christine attempt a new relationship dynamic

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Reality challenge in which eight aspiring wedding planners battle it out to become the best in the business, with six brave couples letting them take control of their big day. The competition gets off to an explosive start as the planners transform an industrial Concorde hangar under the watchful eyes of judges Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya

programme.title: David Harewood on Blackface
programme.desc: David Harewood investigates the roots of minstrelsy, a strange, intensely problematic, cultural form. It eventually paved the way for The Black and White Minstrel Show, which, at its peak, was watched by a Saturday night BBC TV audience of more than 20 million people. David looks at the effect the series had on his own career and that of fellow actors

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is patrolling the forecourt of Wallyford recycling centre in East Lothian, hoping to redirect some metal railings, a tired writing bureau and a collection of marbles

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Sona Datta travels across the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu to explore the development of the Hindu religion through its art and architecture. She examines its beginnings as an amalgamation of local faith traditions through to its dominant mainstream presence today, visiting sacred temples hewn from rock, sandstone and marble, including the ornately carved towers, tanks and courtyards of the Meenakshi Amman Temple in Madurai

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Documentary investigation into the murder of a 13-year-old Israeli schoolgirl in 2006. The public won't accept the verdict. The suspicion for Tair Rada's murder shifts to teenagers, and rumours of a conspiracy spread like wildfire on social media

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Six years after the murder of Tair Rada, a mysterious witness comes forward with new information regarding the case. His story changes everything

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: Surgeon Gabriel Weston explores cases that were cracked by examining the smallest traces of forensic evidence. They include the first murder case solved in the UK based on fingerprint evidence to the patterns of blood in a bedroom which helped overturn an infamous murder conviction. Gabriel also reveals the cutting-edge techniques that are proving vital to catch the killers of today

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski examines how mankind's understanding of mathematics has brought the world closer to understanding the forces of nature. Travelling from the olive groves of Samos to Spain, he gives his own novel proof of Pythagoras's famous theorem, and looks at the interlocking of numbers and nature in the descriptions of musical harmony, early astronomy and perspective in paintings. Originally broadcast in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: From earliest times, mankind has looked outwards from the Earth and wondered at the movements of sun, stars and planets. Jacob Bronowski traces the attempts to map the forces which move the heavens, beginning in the great stone-age cultures of the Americas. First shown in 1973

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Sona Datta travels across the southern Indian state of Tamil Nadu to explore the development of the Hindu religion through its art and architecture. She examines its beginnings as an amalgamation of local faith traditions through to its dominant mainstream presence today, visiting sacred temples hewn from rock, sandstone and marble, including the ornately carved towers, tanks and courtyards of the Meenakshi Amman Temple in Madurai

programme.title: River Walks
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher walks an eight-mile route along the River Lea, taking in the landmarks of an industrial past and discovering what the future holds for the waterway in this fast-growing part of London

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey westwards across the United States, discovering the hidden pleasures of 19th-century railroad workers in Sedalia and learning more about the birthplace of ragtime. He then travels to Paola, Kansas, where he auctions livestock and dines on spare ribs, before reaching his destination in St Joseph, Missouri

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: Frank has problems with a hi-tech toilet while staying with his brother-in-law, but the bungler's attempts to put it right result in more than a few crossed wires. Slapstick comedy, starring Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker settles into his new job as Minister for Administrative Affairs, ably assisted - and hindered - by civil servants Bernard Woolley and Sir Humphrey Appleby. First episode of the comedy, starring Paul Eddington, Nigel Hawthorne and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: A keen MP is appointed to the Department of Social Affairs and Citizenship in a Cabinet reshuffle, but she was so far down the food chain that spin doctor Malcolm Tucker did not have a file on her. It also turns out that she has expensive ideas and is about to face the media at a crucial by-election poster launch. Political comedy, starring Peter Capaldi, Rebecca Front and Chris Addison

programme.title: Mixed Britannia
programme.desc: George Alagiah explores the history of Britain's mixed-race communities, with archive material helping to chart events from the turn of the 20th century. He begins with the romances between women workers and foreign seamen during the First World War, and the street riots they caused in port cities as soldiers returned to find local girls in relationship with non-white men. He also reveals how Britain narrowly escaped laws preventing interracial marriages

programme.title: Mixed Britannia
programme.desc: George Alagiah continues the history of Britain's mixed-race community, focusing on the Second World War to the mid-1960s. The war created a miniature boom in babies born to white British women and black American GIs, a trend that continued with the mass migration following the end of the conflict. Mixed couples, once rare, became more common and society finally witnessed the first interracial kiss on TV

programme.title: Mixed Britannia
programme.desc: George Alagiah concludes the history of interracial Britain, revealing how a new wave of mass immigration from the Indian subcontinent settled in Britain in the 1970s, only for violence to follow with the rise of the National Front. He also learns about the debates surrounding mixed-race adoption, and brings the account up to date with a 21st-century love story about a young couple struggling to overcome cultural prejudice from their community

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey westwards across the United States, discovering the hidden pleasures of 19th-century railroad workers in Sedalia and learning more about the birthplace of ragtime. He then travels to Paola, Kansas, where he auctions livestock and dines on spare ribs, before reaching his destination in St Joseph, Missouri

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: The documentary offering a glimpse into the rarely seen South American wilderness continues, this time following the path of the relentless wind sweeping east through Patagonia's dry desert from the Andes' peaks. The programme reveals a weird world of maras - a large relative of the guinea pig - and penguins, and witnesses the first faltering steps of baby guanacos - Patagonia's very own camels. Cameras also observe the people who have taken on this inhospitable environment and carved out a home for themselves. Santiago Cabrera narrates

programme.title: Tchaikovsky
programme.desc: The story of the composer's life continues with his disastrous decision to wed Antonina Milyukova and his affair with Joseph Kotek which followed three months later. The programme concludes with his death and the debate concerning whether the cause was cholera or suicide. Charles Hazlewood conducts the Mariinsky Young Philharmonic and the talented Russian Sasha Sitkovetsky performs Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto. Ed Stoppard and Alice Glover star

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: Life in the treacherous seas that surround the South American wilderness. The 4,000-mile coast stretches from the cold waters of Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins overcome huge challenges to raise their young - to the far north's much warmer climate, where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert. Orcas ram-raid the beaches, grabbing seal pups to feed their young, and fishermen are also incentivised to gather the sea's bounty. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Forest, Field & Sky: Art Out of Nature
programme.desc: James Fox journeys through six different landscapes across Britain, meeting artists whose work explores the human relationship with the natural world, from Andy Goldsworthy's stone sculptures to James Turrell's extraordinary Skyspaces

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to TV writer and director Sally Wainwright about her life, work and creative process, including her early career writing for The Archers and Coronation Street. Sally talks about her early obsession with television, and how the 1970s musical drama Rock Follies inspired her to become a television writer at a young age

programme.title: Canterbury Tales
programme.desc: The current husband of many-times-divorced actress Beth Craddock leaves her for his mistress, prompting her to respond by turning her attention to co-star Jerome. They become embroiled in a passionate affair but circumstances soon begin to threaten their relationship. Sally Wainwright's modern adaptation of The Wife of Bath, starring Julie Walters and Paul Nicholls. First broadcast in 2003

programme.title: In Conversation
programme.desc: The actress discusses her life and career in an interview recorded at the British Film Institute Southbank, from her movie debut in Educating Rita through roles in Billy Elliot, Calendar Girls and Paddington. Presented by Richard E Grant, who in 2006 cast Walters in his semi-autobiographical directorial debut Wah-Wah. First broadcast in 2015

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk

programme.title: Forest, Field & Sky: Art Out of Nature
programme.desc: James Fox journeys through six different landscapes across Britain, meeting artists whose work explores the human relationship with the natural world, from Andy Goldsworthy's stone sculptures to James Turrell's extraordinary Skyspaces

When they finish, Love Monster thinks it's very different from Elder Kitten's usual style. He starts to wonder whether Elder Kitten will be good surprised or bad surprised. Just then, Elder Kitten returns from his spa day. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Elder Kitten is a little lost for words and, not wanting to hurt their feelings, he simply agrees with them that it's bright and very different. programme.desc: Emily wants to find out more about puffins in this episode, so Rory and Sandy head to a very special Scottish island to search for them. They’re able to see where they nest in burrows and hunt for food by diving into the sea. And Chantelle joins Aneeshwar, who is a keen bird watcher - together they try to spot a puffling, a baby puffin, in the cliffs. Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Emily’s questions. With the help of the special poem, we discover that like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, puffins are superheroes, helping our planet in their own special way. And for this episode’s Teeny Tiny Task, Rory and Sandy decide to be 'more puffin' and decorate each other’s faces with faceprints.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Ted and his family head to the beach, and Ted tries his hand at making a sandcastle. When it doesn’t go quite to plan, Dad shows him some top tips. After some fun flying a kite, the family enjoy a game of catch. And what trip to the beach is complete without an ice cream?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Disa's family comes from the Scandinavian country, Sweden. She is baking kardemummabullar, which is a Swedish recipe for cardamom buns. Disa makes a milk mixture, sweetened with honey, and mixes it into flour to make a dough. She then grinds her special ingredient of cardamom into a powder and adds some into the dough and the rest of it into brown sugar. The dough is flattened, the brown sugar and cardamom mix is spread onto the dough and folded in. The dough is then cut into strips and twisted and wrapped into a bun ready to be baked. Will her friends like the cardamom when it's baked in her kardemummabullar?

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the world of flowers to see how we can help to look after them and our planet. Find out how flowers and different animals, like bees, birds, butterflies and insects, work together. We learn how bees and insects pollinate flowers, as Maddie becomes a bee and plays the pollination game! Along the way, we’ll discover flowers of all different shapes, sizes and colours and learn why they are so different. We discover the different parts of a flower, the stigma, the anther, the stamen and the petals and how some flowers go to sleep at night and open in the day!

programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must decide whether objects will float or sink in a water tank. Then, in a game based on light and shadows, the young scientists have to figure out what their team captains are holding by observing their shadows behind a huge screen. programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: When a strange, lumpy, green ball rolls to their feet, Fred and Pete are sure they've found treasure. But what is it? At the Museum of Cornish Treasures, Archie tells them that their treasure grew up in Cornwall under a big dome, and Suzy sends them to the Eden Project to find out more. Here, they meet Catherine who says their treasure is a type of fruit from a place far away. But how did the fruit get to Cornwall? Suzy buzzes on the Treasure Comm and suggests Fred and Pete take a trip on a zip wire and explore the tropical dome. They meet Catherine again who reveals their treasure is a screw pine fruit. This fruit is usually found in hot countries in Asia and Africa but is able to grow in Eden’s dome because it's so warm inside. Catherine takes Fred and Pete on a plant hunt around the tropical dome. Catherine explains how fruits produce seeds which then grow into new trees that produce fruits themselves

programme.desc: Kyra and Khloe plan a visit to Nana and make chocolate crispy cakes to surprise her with. programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Jessica's family is from Ukraine, a country found in Eastern Europe. This region is known for a soup called borscht, and Jessica will be making some for her friends. Jessica cooks cabbage and spring onions in oil and then adds them to grated carrot, beetroot, potatoes and a tomato and stock mixture. All of these ingredients are combined in a casserole dish. Once they are stirred together, the casserole dish can be placed in the oven to cook. Jessica wears a traditional Ukrainian outfit and serves drinks in a beautiful drinks dispenser. Borscht is famous for being brightly coloured, so will her friends be able to guess that her special ingredient is beetroot?

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on a journey of discovery to find out about plants around the world. Find out how we can help to look after them and our planet, and why and how they grow and survive in different climates. Maddie explores plants in the rainforest, big and small, and sees how the clever drip-tip leaves work watering the plants beneath them. We’ll see how plants in hot, dry parts of world like the desert thrive in their own special ways, like the cactus plant that stores litres of water in its waxy leaves. And we’ll learn how plants that grow close to home in the UK, can grow in a colder and wetter climate.

Then there’s a fast-paced game based on personal hygiene, where the young scientists must race against the clock to brush as much food as possible off giant teeth. Finally, the teams must make their way across a giant inflatable version of the solar system. Can they get from Neptune to Mercury, stepping on every planet in the right order without getting knocked by the swinging stars?

They've found treasure, but what exactly is it? To find out, they jump in the Treasure Truck and head to the Museum of Cornish Treasures - maybe Suzy and Archie can help untangle the mystery! Archie tells them the treasure might be helpful to a seal and Suzy sends them to meet her seal expert friend, Lizzi. Lizzi explains that seals are often spotted along the Cornish coast, but they're also in danger of getting tangled up in beach rubbish. Suzy rings in on the Treasure Comm and sends Fred and Pete off to the Cornish Seal Sanctuary at Gweek to discover more. At the sanctuary, Beth-Anne explains that seals are brought to the sanctuary when they get caught up in beach rubbish the sanctuary can definitely make good use of Fred and Pete’s orange treasure. programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: After an encounter with a school of migrating tuna, the Octonauts discover that one of the speedy fish, Tina, has been left behind. And she’s injured! Poor Tina has a hook stuck in her mouth and is too weak to swim. After Peso tends to her wound, the Octonauts agree to help get her to the tuna spawning grounds. But they’ll have to be quick: egg-laying season doesn’t last long. Luckily, Tweak’s latest gup, the Gup-R, is the fastest she’s ever built! The Octonauts use it to tow Tina, but when the Gup-R’s battery dies, how will they catch up to the rest of her school?

programme.desc: Alistair wants to find out about red squirrels in today’s episode. Rory and Sandy head deep into the forest to try and find some red squirrels, whilst Chantelle heads offshore to an island to meet a local expert who has been studying them in the wild. Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Alistair’s questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem, we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, red squirrels are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Rory shows Sandy what it might feel like to be a red squirrel as he jumps around in the treetops.

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie to discover the plants that we use in our everyday lives and how we can help to look after them and our planet. We use plants like bamboo to build with, we make clothes from plants, and we even turn plants into useful materials like rubber for making wellington boots. And wood we use for musical instruments! Along the way, we discover how latex comes from inside a rubber tree, and Maddie goes high into the rainforest canopy to show us how tall a bamboo plant grows. She also makes a bowl from a banana leaf.

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete are treasure hunting on the sand when they discover a shiny sphere. What’s it for? Maybe Suzy and her robot Archie at the museum can help. Sure enough, Archie’s clue and Suzy’s endless list of Cornish contacts sees the hapless duo rock up in St Columb Major. There they meet Colin, who makes silver-covered balls for the game of hurling. But what exactly is hurling? Even these two can’t miss hurling expert Mayor Paul in his full regalia. Paul explains how hurling is a game played by Town and Country teams in St Columb Major, where the silver ball is thrown and ‘hurled’ between team members, but the pitch consists of the entire town and the goals are miles apart! Fred and Pete soon run out of puff trying to play on their own, but Suzy points them back to the playing fields where the mayor and some children are about to play a game. Fred and Pete’s teams battle it out before returning a silver ball to Suzy to display in the museum

But when the supporting net breaks, the Octonauts have to launch an emergency free-fall rescue!

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Nigeria (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the fifth last-16 match at Lang Park in Brisbane, Australia. England topped their group with a 100 per cent record, labouring to 1-0 wins over Haiti and Denmark, before finding their best form in their final match with an emphatic 6-1 victory over China. Nigeria finished second in Group B after goalless draws with Canada and Republic of Ireland either side of a shock 3-2 victory over Australia

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Denmark (Kick-off 11.30am). Coverage of the sixth last-16 match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney. Despite a defeat at the hands of Nigeria in their second match, victories over Republic of Ireland and Canada gave the co-hosts top spot in Group B, while Denmark finished second in Group D after wins against China and Haiti either side of a loss to England

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood takes on his toughest challenge yet, working as a paramedic in Austin, Texas. His mentor is Cassi Lydon, a veteran paramedic with 14 years' service

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: France v Morocco (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the eighth and concluding last-16 match, which takes place at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. A record of two wins and one draw was enough to see France secure top spot in Group F ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama. Morocco looked unlikely qualifiers after losing their opener 6-0 against Germany, but wins against Korea Republic and group-winners Colombia saw them remarkably finish ahead of the Germans in second place

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton catches up with two house hunters who have moved to Dumfries and Galloway, including a buyer from 2019 whose literary ambitions have come to fruition

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The cases of a crooked tradesman dubbed the worst builder in Wales, and a serial flytipper who flees the country to escape from the environment agency

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow developers' progress on a flat in Brentwood, Essex; a smart one-bed flat in Glasgow, and a three bedroom house in Bodiam, East Sussex with countryside views that is destined to be a holiday home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset with the teams being led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha learns about a Victorian gadget that combines fashion and function

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park says goodbye to Sonia the Hippopotamus and the keepers look back on their time with her. Hamza Yassin uses his camera to keep an eye on Sonia's companion Spot as she mourns. On the other side of the park, the keepers have their hands full with a Catalina Macaw who loves escaping

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets Springwatch presenter Gillian Burke, who takes Rick on a walk through a rare habitat called an Atlantic temperate rainforest on the banks of the Helford River

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah retraces her steps with two sporty couples in the counties of Staffordshire and Hampshire. In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing £7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans restore a vintage toy car that has reached the end of the road, a legal eagle's briefcase and a scrapbook charting the career of an amateur 1930s footballer

programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores North Radnorshire and Montgomeryshire. He begins his journey on a beautiful pasture at Tylcau Hill near Llanbister bursting with colour from wildflowers and rare butterflies. Next stop is Dolfor near Newtown, one of the last remaining strongholds for the curlew in Wales

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets through to Ben after finding him in a terrible state at the Boxing Den. Whitney and Zack have a difficult conversation while Sonia and Reiss have a heart-to-heart. Patrick ponders the future

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1930s pinball machine, an antique weather device and a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: It's '70s night in Judges for staff and members and helping them groove away the night are the four young members who make up the Valleys tribute band, Adrenalin. Joining them in the hall are hipsters Linda and her fiancé Kelvin. By day Linda is a Gavin & Stacey tour guide, but by night she is a bingo wild child with poised dabber in hand

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: England v Nigeria (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the fifth last-16 match at Lang Park in Brisbane, Australia. England topped their group with a 100 per cent record, labouring to 1-0 wins over Haiti and Denmark, before finding their best form in their final match with an emphatic 6-1 victory over China. Nigeria finished second in Group B after goalless draws with Canada and Republic of Ireland either side of a shock 3-2 victory over Australia

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v Denmark (Kick-off 11.30am). Coverage of the sixth last-16 match, held at Stadium Australia in Sydney. Despite a defeat at the hands of Nigeria in their second match, victories over Republic of Ireland and Canada gave the co-hosts top spot in Group B, while Denmark finished second in Group D after wins against China and Haiti either side of a loss to England

programme.title: EastEnders

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end-of-life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Jack delves deeper into the Donkey Pitch case, arranging a prison visit and listening to recordings of Lincoln interviewing Sophie and Hugo's classmates. When challenged by Lincoln, he reveals the secrets of his own past. Honey discovers CCTV cameras set up in the garden, and begins to suspect that he and Molina are pawns in someone's elaborate game

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Adil Ray guest hosts the satirical current affairs quiz, with writer and presenter Richard Osman and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines

programme.title: We Are England
programme.desc: England football midfielder Jill Scott inspires the next generation of Lionesses to success at her childhood club in the north-east. Boldon CA Girls is the grassroots football club that has produced three Lionesses - Jill Scott, Demi Stokes and captain Steph Houghton. Now the young players at Boldon are training hard and dreaming big. After the success of the England women's team winning Euro 2022, these girls believe they can do it too

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a mother and daughter-in-law from Bristol, two friends from Basingstoke and Camberley, and neighbours from Nottingham

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits Whitby. Isolated between the North York Moors National Park and the sombre North Sea, this North Yorkshire seaside town has been attracting people with its architectural, geological, and literary charms for generations. This May marked the 125th year since the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula, a novel that was influenced by Whitby's folkloric past and continues to shape this maritime outpost. To celebrate the occasion, Sean visits the people of Whitby who work and protect its coastline today

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood takes on his toughest challenge yet, working as a paramedic in Austin, Texas. His mentor is Cassi Lydon, a veteran paramedic with 14 years' service

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a Welsh chapel and terraced houses in Newcastle-under-Lyme and Offerton as they are sold at auction

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: France v Morocco (Kick-off 12.00pm). Coverage of the eighth and concluding last-16 match, which takes place at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. A record of two wins and one draw was enough to see France secure top spot in Group F ahead of Jamaica, Brazil and Panama. Morocco looked unlikely qualifiers after losing their opener 6-0 against Germany, but wins against Korea Republic and group-winners Colombia saw them remarkably finish ahead of the Germans in second place

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton catches up with two house hunters who have moved to Dumfries and Galloway, including a buyer from 2019 whose literary ambitions have come to fruition

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives blacksmith Alex and furniture-maker Cora the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. Although incredibly passionate about his craft, Alex suffers with imposter syndrome but mentor Adrian Wood is hoping to help him see the beauty in his work. Cora gave up her day job, determined to follow her dreams but dislikes the small details and often jumps to the next job before finishing the first. Mentor Alice thinks Cora has great taste and believes her best chance at making her dreams reality is to focus on the designing rather than making every piece herself

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. Dominic Chinea gets to work on an ingenious artist's tool from the 1920s and toy repairers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell give some TLC to a baby seal that is no longer very furry

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Following Lou's offer to move abroad, Amber talks to Stevie about her past relationships and her fears that history will repeat itself

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Honey tries to get a very reluctant Ben to open up to Callum. Patrick has a big decision to make and Reiss tries to charm his way into Sonia's good books. Zack receives some good news

programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers how three years before her death, Gaia was approached online by an older man who turned out to be at the centre of a world of webcamming and online grooming in Dorset. Despite multiple warnings from those closest to her, Gaia wanted to help him and they became close

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: A unique insight into living with dwarfism, through the experiences of Tricia Mailey and two of her children, who were born with achondroplasia, the most common form of dwarfism. Primary school teacher Tricia Mailey is mum to Cara, 12, Noah, 5, and one-year-old Bethany. Tricia and husband Sean run a home filled with laughter and love, but what makes this everyday family so unique is that Tricia and her two elder children have the height-restricting condition achondroplasia, while Sean and Bethany are average-height
