programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Suzie Fletcher take on the repair of a special, worn by the owner's grandfather throughout the First World War as part of his uniform as a Seaforth highlander. Dominic Chinea gets to work on an ingenious artist's tool from the 1920s and toy repairers Amanda Middleditch and Julie Tatchell give some TLC to a baby seal that is no longer very furry

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford report on the holiday makers who arrived at their hotels only to discover they'd been closed for years

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Honey tries to get a very reluctant Ben to open up to Callum. Patrick has a big decision to make and Reiss tries to charm his way into Sonia's good books. Zack receives some good news

programme.title: Why Ships Crash
programme.desc: When one of the largest container ships ever built, the Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal in March 2021, it triggered a global crisis. Using never-before seen footage, testimony from witnesses speaking for the very first time, and expert analysis, this investigation aims to uncover the inside story of the Ever Given accident. And with more than 2,500 shipping incidents a year, this film also asks if this was just a freak accident, or whether it reveals a serious weakness in the world's critical supply chain

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: As he investigates further, Jack becomes convinced the Donkey Pitch killer is still at large. In the house of horrors, Honey is paranoid they are being watched. Sophie's post-mortem reveals she was taking unprescribed antidepressants

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bikes!
programme.desc: Stephen Watson presents highlights of the motorcycling event from County Antrim, which was first held in 1977. Despite being the youngest Irish road-racing event, it has grown into a must-see meeting that attracts the sport's biggest names

programme.title: Gaia: A Death on Dancing Ledge
programme.desc: Zara McDermott discovers how three years before her death, Gaia was approached online by an older man who turned out to be at the centre of a world of webcamming and online grooming in Dorset. Despite multiple warnings from those closest to her, Gaia wanted to help him and they became close

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end of life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is at Oxfordshire Wildlife Rescue to help care for injured creatures. Ellie finds out why rescue centres across the UK become increasingly busy during the summer months and why this Oxfordshire centre is under so much pressure that it's had to temporarily close its doors. Plus, clips from the archives featuring footage by some of Britain's finest wildlife film-makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood samples life working on a cattle ranch in Austin, Texas, where he gets to grips with farm machinery and faces one of his biggest fears, horses

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The cases of a crooked tradesman dubbed the worst builder in Wales, and a serial flytipper who flees the country to escape from the environment agency

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow developers' progress on a flat in Brentwood, Essex; a smart one-bed flat in Glasgow, and a three bedroom house in Bodiam, East Sussex with countryside views that is destined to be a holiday home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset with the teams being led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha learns about a Victorian gadget that combines fashion and function

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park says goodbye to Sonia the Hippopotamus and the keepers look back on their time with her. Hamza Yassin uses his camera to keep an eye on Sonia's companion Spot as she mourns. On the other side of the park, the keepers have their hands full with a Catalina Macaw who loves escaping

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets Springwatch presenter Gillian Burke, who takes Rick on a walk through a rare habitat called an Atlantic temperate rainforest on the banks of the Helford River

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah retraces her steps with two sporty couples in the counties of Staffordshire and Hampshire. In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing £7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans restore a vintage toy car that has reached the end of the road, a legal eagle's briefcase and a scrapbook charting the career of an amateur 1930s footballer

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville turn the spotlight on the big name holiday companies viewers say are letting them down. Plus, Simon Calder with advice on how to save money while sightseeing

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets through to Ben after finding him in a terrible state at the Boxing Den. Whitney and Zack have a difficult conversation while Sonia and Reiss have a heart-to-heart. Patrick ponders the future

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1930s pinball machine, an antique weather device and a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end-of-life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.desc: When Tintin and the detectives get lost in the desert, the situation regarding the fuel explosions becomes clearer

programme.desc: Badminton is being played at the Games

programme.desc: Gregor MacLeod and home bakers from across Scotland share their bread-baking recipes. Gregor reveals the trick to the classic French croissant with its layers of flaky puff pastry. He fills his with a generous helping of chocolate. He's also out and about sampling many tasty loaves - from a cheese and onion tear ‘n' share bread with a crispy cheesy crust, to moist, fruity hot cross buns

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Learner Mirren Buchanan from Thurso chats to Joy Dunlop in the studio, and Calum Maclean visits Ayrshire, where he gets to know some powerful local inhabitants

programme.title: Sgoil nan Sagart/Priest School
programme.desc: Following Ronald Campbell from Benbecula, who is studying for the priesthood in Rome

programme.title: All That Lies Behind Me (Sgeulachd Donald Merrett)
programme.desc: Using dramatic reconstructions and expert opinion, John Morrison revisits the story of John Donald Merrett - a murderer who, having been cleared of killing his mother in 1927, spent the next 30 years on a spree across Europe, spending a large inheritance on women and the black market. The programme also reveals how when Merrett returned to Britain, he killed his wife and mother-in-law, before committing suicide

Ge-tà, chan eil Bing a' cumail sùil ro gheur air na tha e a' togail…! programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Laura and Kirsty from Birmingham, Iqra and her mum Rhaina from Birmingham, and Hertfordshire sisters Lydia and Celeste use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Maitland, Andrew, Hannah and Jason pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel and Jai's plans are jeopardised. Nate taps into a way of making extra money. Amelia wants them to flee but Dan disagrees

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Staff and regulars unite to help Jenny to save the Rovers, Rufus's widow alarms Stephen with an update on the inquest, and Stu catches Eliza meeting a strange man

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two men hoping to find birth family. Joe McGregor was adopted as a baby in Bermuda in the 1970s and grew up in Norfolk in a loving family, yet he still yearns to find his birth family. Simon Miller's mum's dying wish was that he should find the daughter who she gave up for adoption just a few years before he was born

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: Documentary examining the role social media played in the death of British backpacker Grace Millane, who went missing while on a Tinder date in New Zealand in 2018. Featuring interviews with people who knew her or were involved with the investigation, with revealing police interview footage and CCTV

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the opening fixtures of the season, including Middlesbrough v Millwall at Riverside Stadium and Blackburn Rovers v West Bromwich Albion at Ewood Park and Norwich City v Hull City at Carrow Road in the Championship

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili host the quiz as Luan, Ben, Charley, Alex, Rhian, Adrienne, Stuart, Richard and Denise try to be among the four that make the final round for chance to win the four-digit jackpot defined by the number they were each assigned at the start

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands, including creating the soles of Dr Marten's, and making Wagon Wheels. Narrated by Jimmy Nail

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Colombia v Jamaica (Kick-off 9.00am). Live coverage of the seventh last-16 match, which takes place at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. Colombia topped Group H despite a shock 1-0 defeat against Morocco in their final contest, having already defeated Korea Republic and pre-tournament group favourites Germany. Jamaica claimed second place in Group F despite only scoring one goal in three matches, which was good enough for a 1-0 win over Panama, sandwiched between 0-0 draws against France and Brazil. Presented by Laura Woods, with analysis from Karen Carney and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Pien Meulensteen and Emma Hayes

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: The chef prepares tasty recipes as well as chatting with celebrity guests, who reminisce about their favourite meals

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Gareth Ward for a tour of Mid Wales. They begin at a cider-tasting, which James uses to dish up some cider-infused apple fritters. Gareth discovers a farm where the Wagyu cattle fed on local beer. Away from the culinary activities, Gareth is challenged to a rally car ride and James demonstrates his dog training prowess with his trusty hound Cooper

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: The fast-paced game of words hosted by Adil Ray. Fighting it out today are Natassja and her Auntie Ashley from Northern Ireland, and married couples Jay and Shruti from Hertfordshire and Ian and Mary from Devon

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Gordon, Peter, Chloe and Helen pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel decides to join Jai in India but is captured by Colin. Nate double deals. Dan makes a decision about his future

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets four-year-old Lucy, who has travelled down from Glasgow for the latest check-up to monitor her pulmonary hypertension - a high blood pressure condition that affects the lungs. He also meets 13-year-old Connor, who is on the isolation ward as he prepares for a bone marrow transplant to help treat leukaemia. As the youngster needs to live in a sterile environment to protect his weakened immune system, Paul can only speak to him through a window - but that doesn't stop him finding a number of fun and interesting ways to keep Connor occupied during his recovery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team make over a family garden in south Wales, for the benefit of father-of-three Chris Garlick, who lost his hands and feet to sepsis just 22 months earlier. Katie Rushworth creates a contemporary water-feature-cum-bench that would look good in any garden and Frances Tophill shows how soft naturalistic planting with the emphasis on scent can create the perfect garden for wellness

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the final of the celebrity cookery series, as the three remaining stars face their toughest challenge yet in a bid to walk off with the title. The stakes are high, and only one will be crowned this year's winner

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Code Blue: Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary revealing how detectives solved two murders - from the first 'Code Blue' call to the crime scene, through to the convictions of the killers. In the first part, a 999 call from a distraught daughter launches a murder investigation to find the brutal killer of a beloved grandmother, June Fox-Roberts. With access to the South Wales Police's Major Crimes Unit, detectives try to identify the killer through CCTV footage in the hours before and after June's death

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents action from the sixth meeting of the season, held at the Croft Circuit, where the 16th, 17th and 18th races of the season took place. With commentary by David Addison and Tim Harvey, and reports from Louise Goodman

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panellists - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - try to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Keith, Heather, Bal, Jack, Lucy, Karen, Michael, Lynne and Steve battle one another in the hope of taking their number to the final and winning the prize pot. Omid Djalili hosts

programme.title: Gino's Cooking Up Love
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts a dating show with a culinary twist, as he opens his cooking school to six singles looking for love, while also teaching them how to cook authentic, Italian cuisine. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Colin's unstable behaviour escalates. Dan asks Cain for help. Tracy thinks Nate is doing well at work

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gemma asks Henry to reconsider his decision, Stu informs Bridget of Eliza's contact with her father, and Lou tells Stephen that Rufus's death was no accident

programme.title: Kate Garraway's Life Stories
programme.desc: The presenter is joined by comedian, performer and author Ruby Wax. Kate looks back at her acting, presenting career, and how her writing talent has created some of the most memorable characters in comedy. Ruby reveals the relationship she had with her parents growing up in America's Midwest, and how she escaped the trauma of her childhood by running away to drama school on the other side of the world

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Social Media Murders
programme.desc: The killing of the 15-year-old, who was groomed on the internet by Matthew Mason, who murdered Alex as he wanted to keep their relationship secret. Featuring interviews with Alex's family and friends, and police officers involved in the case

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Anarchic comedian Johnny Vegas and broadcaster Alex Brooker embark on a road trip to explore their family histories. Alex knows nothing about his family history, and is shocked to unearth the story of an ancestor whose alleged misdemeanour hit the newspapers. Meanwhile, Johnny is aware that generations of his family have worked in St Helens, and is fascinated to learn of the ancestor who moved his family northwards through the booming industry of glassblowing

programme.title: EFL Carabao Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Action from matches in the first round of the competition, which is divided into North and South sections, and included Wrexham v Wigan Athletic, and Burton Albion v Leicester City

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Five mystery celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes - Chameleon, Duck, Hedgehog, Queen Bee and Unicorn - designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the third celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Thousands of sewage spills annually take place in waters around the country. Combined with other pollution, some beaches are now in such a bad state that visitors are being officially advised to stay out entirely. Experts say our infrastructure badly needs upgrading - but how much will your bill need to rise in order to pay for it? Joe Crowley investigates

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Paul Ainsworth and Nyesha Arrington front the culinary challenge which sees a mixture of home cooks and professional chefs competing across a three-storey kitchen. This week, the nine remaining cooks are challenged to recreate a classic, homely dish that is a firm favourite with families. Gordon also has a surprise in store for the contestants, as his daughter and fellow food fanatic Tilly visits the kitchen

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley's adventure brings him to North Africa and the Moroccan city of Marrakesh, where he attends a pottery lesson to learn how to make authentic tagine pots, and makes a dish that is a true celebration of Morocco, a sweet potato and butternut squash tagine. Later, he hits the main square in Marrakesh for some street food, before heading to the kitchen to prepare harissa and preserved lemon chicken skewers

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: The presenter makes his way to Seville in southern Spain, where he visits the San Leandro convent, where nuns have been selling homemade sweets to visitors for 400 years. Then, he finds the perfect spot for his cookbook kitchen, where he whips up a charred orange and spiced almond salad. Later, Ainsley learns about all things Iberico ham from deli owner Elio, before heading back to his pop up kitchen to whip up a sandwich

programme.desc: Anarchic comedian Johnny Vegas and broadcaster Alex Brooker embark on a road trip to explore their family histories. Alex knows nothing about his family history, and is shocked to unearth the story of an ancestor whose alleged misdemeanour hit the newspapers. programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise announcement on his birthday that causes an argument between Weatherill and Ormerod, but the celebrations are interrupted when a bus full of day-trippers plunges down a nearby embankment. Susie bets Lizzie she will get Carnegie to ask her out, and Jack is given a fright when a body in the mortuary springs back to life. Rural drama starring Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanagh and co-starring Gareth Hale

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: With Susie and Carnegie's relationship the talk of the hospital, Matron reaches the end of her tether when her niece turns up late for work and she decides to suspend her. Mr Rose faces a personal trial when his golfing friend ends up in the operating room and Dr Burnett wrestles with a dilemma. Ormerod and Bobby try to rescue a farmer who is trapped under a combine harvester. Starring Sarah Beck Mather, Wendy Craig and Damian O'Hare

programme.desc: Dawn struggles to cope with her conflicting feelings for Scott, while Katie is driven to distraction by Robert and Donna's noisy antics, and Val has a spring in her step - much to Diane's amusement

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Katie is stunned to find Robert sneaking Donna into the Sugden house, while Val's upfront approach scares the living daylights out of Danny, and Emily makes a shocking discovery at Holdgate Farm

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Joe is forced to tell Karen the truth about his plans for the takeover bid after she spots a strange invoice, a lie comes home to roost for Curly, and Gail apologises to Sarah for being so heavy-handed

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Karen agrees to become part of Joe's takeover scheme, the truth about the surprise visit of Mike's son Adam comes out and Curly plays the dutiful husband by agreeing to go to Emma's works gathering.

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver takes up Simon's challenge to learn judo - but the antique dealer quickly finds himself regretting his impetuousness. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon learns the property next to the antique shops is being sold to a fast food chain and that the deal is being handled by oily estate agent Brimley, with whom he was at school. Brimley claims he will only reconsider the sale if Simon and Oliver pay him a hefty bribe, but when it transpires he is having an extramarital affair, the duo hold the upper hand

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Burnett races to save two schoolgirls who have fallen unconscious with carbon monoxide poisoning, while Susie has to think fast when Matron collapses during their picnic and ends up in hospital, giving the student nurse the chance to prove herself. Elsewhere, Weatherill gets to the bottom of a family problem involving a man training for the priesthood. Damian O'Hare, Sarah Beck Mather and Wendy Craig star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Sister Brigid helps secure a future for Moira and her baby, but when events take a shocking turn Weatherill and Ormerod are left to make a heartbreaking decision. Susie tries her best to be a model nurse and breaks off her relationship with Carnegie - who then proposes to her - while Bobby takes matters into his own hands with the violent stepfather of a local thug. Linda Armstrong, Amy Robbins, Robert Daws and Sarah Beck Mather star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy is forced to confront painful memories when he is subjected to a series of attacks and Walker begins to suspect a recently released prisoner may be involved. Lord Ashfordly's visiting relatives receive a cool reception and Bernie is shocked to find Rosie working at the garage, but impressed once he discovers her lucrative new venture. Starring Mark Jordon, Jonathan Kerrigan and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton and Walker investigate a security van raid in Ashfordly and are convinced there is a link to a recent robbery at a local airfield, but a senior officer visiting from Middlesbrough dismisses their claims. Vernon takes a sudden interest in the flower show when he discovers David might be the owner of a rare, potentially prize-winning fuchsia and turns to Blaketon and Ventress for help when the plant suddenly disappears

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Katie tells Viv what her daughter has been up to, but her malicious actions backfire when Andy lets Donna and Robert move in. Val steps up her campaign to seduce Danny and Chas falls foul of another employer

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val is thrilled to be torn between two would-be lovers, while Terry celebrates his first wedding anniversary, but how long can Dawn keep her illicit feelings for Scott under wraps?

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les hits rock bottom as he faces up to a stretch behind bars, Curly and Emma try to sort out their marital problems and Karen helps forge Mike's signature on bogus company cheques

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A guilt-stricken Karen begins to get cold feet after Mike discusses leaving Underworld to his son, and Les has hope when a homeless man who witnessed the attack comes forward

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A local gigolo is murdered, forcing Jack to face the uncomfortable fact that some women are willing to pay for sex - and triggering an investigation that takes him into the seedy world of male escorts and their clientele. David Jason stars as the old-fashioned copper, with Isla Blair, Russell Hunter, Joanna David and Martin Jarvis

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Colonel and Joan Maltravers host a dinner party to celebrate their son's return from Kenya but the meal is disrupted by an armed robbery. David gives chase to the thief and becomes a local hero - much to the exasperation of Bernie. Liz has a difficult decision to make after receiving an exciting offer from Ben. Guest starring Simon Williams, his wife Lucy Fleming and their son Tam Williams

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate the murder of an ex-army recluse and archaeological enthusiast and suspect a building dispute could provide a motive, while Dennis asks Liz for advice when he begins to notice a change in Jenny's behaviour. Vernon decides to play Cupid on behalf of his relative Gareth and sets him up on a blind date with Rosie, but does not count on the mechanic having another admirer. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Aislin McGuckin and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival, the unveiling of a newly discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime writer George Summersbee is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and local artist Suzie Colebrooke is electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new father Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer? With Fiona Dolman, Tamzin Malleson, Liberty Mills, Una Stubbs and Georgia Taylor

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The team tries to juggle three cases over the course of one day, beginning at 6am when Brooks and Casey are called to a crime scene where a barman has been shot dead in his car. Then, a family dispute leads to murder, and the frenetic morning takes an unexpected turn when an allegation of police intimidation is made against one of the officers. Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls star

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: With their victim identified, Cassie and Sunny begin to find out a bit more about David Walker by talking to his ex-wife, DI Tessa Nixon, who reveals he suffered from depression. A search through the original investigation files and some numbers from David's pager help build a picture of him - and also lead to a few potential suspects. However, his son Jason struggles to deal with the news that someone murdered his dad. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Nigel Lindsay and Will Brown

programme.desc: Dr Ellis confronts local prejudice when he discovers one of his patients has contracted a rare disease abroad. programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victim's electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton investigates the murder of a retired policeman who was about to flee the village for Spain and, after visiting the victim's widow, discovers the man kept more than a few secrets from his wife. Vernon decides to arrange a poker night in the hope it will make him easy money, but doesn't count on playing against a hustler. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Geoffrey Hughes and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: First of a two-part storyline. Jenny's life starts to spiral out of control and begins to affect her work, leaving Dennis and Liz facing difficult decisions. New doctor Helen Trent arrives in Aidensfield with her wealthy husband Matt, hoping to make a fresh start, but finds it hard to adjust to the slow pace of life in the country. Sophie Ward joins the regular cast, including Sarah Tansey, Duncan Bell and Aislin McGuckin

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A police lab technician is stabbed to death in her home and while Brooks and Casey pursue their lead suspect, another woman is attacked in an identical fashion. The second victim survives and is able to identify her assailant, but she and Casey fall for each other - a relationship that threatens to damage both the CPS's case and the detective's career. Guest starring Lydia Leonard, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Sunny makes further investigations into David Walker's life that suggest he was a troubled man with a number of issues. Cassie has a prickly chat with Marion about her past and the inquiry reveals her close relationship with an IRA activist. As the police investigation encroaches on their life, Sara and Colin open up to their partners with secrets about their past. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Wendy Craig and Holly Aird

programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave helps a local old lady called Tanya, who rewards him by giving him a sausage to say thank you - is Dave imagining it, or does something lucky happen every time he takes a bite?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus' friendship is tested when they find a chrysalis and can't agree on what to do with it - they think they have the answer when the chrysalis starts communicating with a series of knocks, but is it one knock for 'yes' or one knock for 'no'?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Bob's best friend Gummy goes missing, Lloyd and Abacus take on the task of finding him... which is only right as they were the ones who lost him. Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler tries to retrieve his credit card from a cash dispenser, but ends up trapped in a bank vault. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. City Hall set up a day for kids to pick up litter in the city. Noomi sees this as her chance to spend a romantic day with Mo. But Mo has one thing only on his mind: the top level in his video game! All he has to do is cross the bridge, fight the last duel and he'll win! But it's hopeless: every time, Mo botches this ultimate challenge. He requests the Scepter to grant him the power to enter his video game and cross the bridge for real!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam gets jealous when Stella starts spending more time with Janelle because they both love sports, and the invention of a new sport called 'Basket-Boing' threatens to overshadow their friendship. Convinced that she'll impress Stella and win back her attention by scoring baskets, Sam asks for the power of perfect aim - the only problem is that Sam and Mo's aim is off by ten centimetres at half-power! In order to wow Stella on the court, Sam is going to need Mo's help...

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby and the gang accept an invitation from famous actor Malcolm McDowell to take an exploratory trip through time, they find themselves actually traveling into the future.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Benchwarmer Porky finally gets his chance to shine on the pitching mound. With the game on the line, he's going to need all the help he can get, even if it's from Daffy. / Sylvester tries to catch Tweety in his nest on top of a telephone pole. / After Elmer sets his sights on Daffy and feeds him a bomb, Daffy starts following him around, causing Elmer to run for his life. Who's hunting who?

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Issa and J.P. help Pedro to become super-intelligent by using a Bluetooth earpiece... and it works! Pedro has some success in Bamboozle by helping locals solve their problems - thanks to his great intelligence - and even gets a date with Zoe who loves smart boys... but when a problem with the connection develops, Pedro is up the creek without a paddle!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. When a new novel by a famous crime author comes out, it's a huge deal, and our heroes are inspired to do a bit of detective work themselves. First they need to find a mystery to solve... who's hiding behind the Clookie-Clooka mask, the mascot for the local mall? If they manage to solve the mystery, they'll become popular and respected by all the detective story fans, but can they really spill the beans?

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. Benny, the sweetest and most popular dog in the neighbourhood, suddenly and radically changes personalities after seeing an enigmatic symbol engraved on a tree in the park. He snubs his friends and even bites his beloved master.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to trap Mr Magoo - while Weasel captures Mr Cat and sends him to a far-off destination, Fizz demands a ransom from Mr Magoo and sends him an anonymous letter with a meeting point. However, Mr Magoo mistakes the letter for a treasure map...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo, who is on the roof of a building, believes he's by the sea - when he dives in to save a drowning swimmer (in reality, a statue in a traffic circle) he is struck by Fizz's laser and then becomes weightless.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo replaces his friend Serge for the day as a personal trainer - while he thinks he's giving a swimming lesson at the pool, he appears at Weasel's house at the worst moment: for the first time in his life, Fizz is out of ideas...

programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary telling the story of one of the UK's largest murder investigations, with police hunting for a serial killer who abducted and murdered Jennifer Cardy, Susan Maxwell, Caroline Hogg and Sarah Harper in the 1980s. Detectives from multiple forces attempted to join the dots between the murders using antiquated policing systems, but without vehicle registration recognition, CCTV or even fully-fledged computer systems, could they close the net before the killer struck again?

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: Leap Year (2010)
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad (1958)
programme.desc: The heroic sailor pits his wits against an evil magician who has shrunk a princess to the size of a doll - but to break the spell, he must journey to a mysterious island inhabited by hideous monsters and find a magic lamp. Fantasy adventure, starring Kerwin Mathews, Kathryn Grant and Torin Thatcher, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding (1997)
programme.desc: A food critic realises she is in love with her best friend just as he announces he is going to marry another woman. Determined to have him to herself, she heads for the wedding with the intention of sabotaging the ceremony - but persuading the groom to give up on his bride-to-be proves harder than expected. Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts, Dermot Mulroney, Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017)
programme.desc: Four teenagers play a jungle-themed game on an old console, only to find themselves transported into the game and transformed into its heroic characters. They must embark on a death-defying journey through the game's wilderness setting to make it back to the real world, or be stuck as video game characters forever. Fantasy action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service (2015)
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster turn out to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Funny Cow (2018)
programme.desc: A stand-up comedian fights for success on the brutally unforgiving working men's club scene of 1970s northern England. Drama, starring Maxine Peake, Stephen Graham, Paddy Considine and Tony Pitts, who also wrote the screenplay

programme.title: Megamind (2010)
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Tooth Fairy (2010)
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton (1957)
programme.desc: Lord Loam is proud of his tendency to treat his staff as equals - to a point - while his manservant Crichton believes people should know their place. However, when the entire household is shipwrecked on a desert island, it is the resourceful butler who rises to the top of the pecking order - to the horror of his supposedly liberal master. Comedy based on JM Barrie's play, starring Kenneth More, Cecil Parker, Diane Cilento and Peter Graves

programme.title: Dad's Army (1971)
programme.desc: The ragtag soldiers of the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard are given the chance to prove their mettle by apprehending three German aviators who have parachuted into the country in the vanguard of a suspected Nazi invasion. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses (2016)
programme.desc: A suburban couple become embroiled in an international espionage plot when they discover that their seemingly perfect new neighbours are actually government spies. Action comedy, starring Zach Galifianakis, Isla Fisher, Jon Hamm and Gal Gadot

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level (2019)
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the world's most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdan's fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: Somers Town (2008)
programme.desc: Troubled youngster Tommo runs away to London where he meets Marek, a shy Polish immigrant who lives with his labourer father in run-down Somers Town. Tommo moves into their small flat, and the pair end up doing odd jobs for an eccentric neighbour and competing for the attention of a French waitress - while trying to keep their escapades a secret from Marek's father. Shane Meadows' comedy drama, starring Thomas Turgoose, Piotr Jagiello and Ireneusz Czop

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Born Free (1966)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama chronicling the lives of game wardens Joy and George Adamson, who adopted an orphaned lion cub in Kenya and trained the animal to survive in the wild so that one day it might return to its natural habitat. Starring Virginia McKenna, Bill Travers and Geoffrey Keen

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir (1947)
programme.desc: A lonely widow moves into a seaside cottage, despite rumours that it is haunted. Sure enough, she finds herself sharing her home with the spirit of a dead sea captain - but his efforts to scare her away prove unsuccessful, and instead a growing attraction develops between the pair as she agrees to write his biography. Romantic fantasy, starring Gene Tierney, Rex Harrison and George Sanders

programme.title: The Golden Child (1986)
programme.desc: A private eye is recruited by a group of Buddhist mystics and sent on a mission to rescue an abducted boy whose supernatural powers will enable him to bring about world peace. However, the kidnapper is actually a demon in human form, determined to ensure the youngster does not fulfil his destiny. Comedy fantasy adventure, starring Eddie Murphy, Charles Dance and Charlotte Lewis

programme.title: Predator (1987)
programme.desc: An elite military team takes on a top-secret mission in the jungles of Central America, but the soldiers realise they have been deceived by their CIA employers. A greater danger presents itself when they are stalked by a lethal alien big-game hunter with the power to become invisible, that has come to Earth to stalk human prey. Sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers and Bill Duke

programme.title: C'mon C'mon (2021)
programme.desc: Johnny and his young nephew forge a tenuous but transformational relationship when they are unexpectedly thrown together. Drama from writer-director Mike Mills, starring Joaquin Phoenix and Woody Norman

programme.title: Fragments of Paradise (2022)
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling the career and work of late Lithuanian-American poet and filmmaker Jonas Mekas, who documented his own life for more than 70 years in 'diary films' such as Walden. American admirers such as Peter Bogdanovich, Martin Scorsese and John Waters are among those who add their voices to the tribute

programme.desc: Candida Leaver and Peter Starling, owners of the Bower Inn in Bridgwater, Somerset, play host in the last round of the week. The group activity is willow-weaving, and at dinner time the guests reveal what they think of their no-nonsense hosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Dagmar the giraffe is supporting her closest herd member Orla, whose new calf is overdue - but at the same time she is reluctant to allow her own youngest to feed properly. So the keepers plan a herd birth in the hope that both mothers can learn from each other. There is concern when two of the spider monkeys withdraw from their family, while two devoted camels experience the trauma of separation when one undergoes an operation

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Life at Animal Welfare League NSW, a picturesque dog sanctuary where people come in search of a canine soulmate

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of musician Toby Leeming as he sets out to build a house wrapped around an ancient oak tree in rural Suffolk. The design for Toby's five-building home contains six bedrooms, six bathrooms, a music studio and an annexe - a vast project more like a village than a house. Creating this life changing vision on a £530k budget, and in only eight months, will not be an easy task, especially as they must build up close to an ancient oak without destroying any of the roots

programme.title: Remarkable Places to Eat
programme.desc: Revival of the series in which celebrities take Fred Sirieix to experience dining at their favourite restaurants. In the first episode, Fred and Dermot O'Leary explore Puglia's food culture, visiting restaurants that celebrate Puglia's fabled cucina povera, or poor man's cooking

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the most hidden and remote hotels on the planet. The first episode visits a hotel on the banks of the Timor Rung River in Cambodia, the clifftop Sextantio Le Grotte della Civita Hotel in Italy, two unique and camouflaged sites in Wales, a remote village surrounded by forests in Swedish Lapland, and a secluded island 250 metres off the coast of Devon

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: New staff nurse Sophie attends to 22-year-old chef James, who accidentally stabbed himself in the leg while chopping tomatoes. During an eventful shift, she also uses chest compressions to keep alive another patient and helps 54-year-old Bernard, who was out cold for 10 minutes after falling and banging his head against a car. However, when his family arrives, it turns out he had been drinking

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A head-on car accident in Cumbria leaves Nick's life hanging in the balance, East Anglian heli-meds land on a roundabout island to help Craig who has come off his motorbike and smashed headfirst into a signpost. Plus, medics battle extreme weather conditions to reach a man trapped under his JCB digger

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A look at some of the heart attack cases the West Midlands Ambulance Service paramedics are faced with, including a man whose heart has stopped beating. The crew manage to get it started again, only for it to stop once more

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: New staff nurse Sophie attends to 22-year-old chef James, who accidentally stabbed himself in the leg while chopping tomatoes. However, when his family arrives, it turns out he had been drinking

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

Kate Quilton meets a Devon resident who loves to eat nettles, and Amanda Byram learns why some foods such as rhubarb and custard seem so inseparable

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Angellica Bell make stylish braided coasters, and presenter Amanda Lamb faces actress Debra Stephenson in the timed challenge, where they have 30 minutes to create personalised embossed greeting cards

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steve and Linda from south Wales are no strangers to Spain. They've been visiting for over 10 years and feel that now's the perfect time to buy their very own holiday home on the Orihuela Costa. They'd ideally like a three-bedroom house or apartment close to the beach so ask Jean Johansson to help match them with their perfect property within a £100,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Road Trip
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix visits the Orange Blossom coast and the area surrounding Valencia, where he meets two Londoners who have taken on a mandarin self-pick farm, a couple setting up a vegan restaurant in Javea and two British expats setting up a cycling business in the city of Valencia

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a gramophone and a stow-away bed to restore. Meanwhile, Simon accidently puts his foot through a drum

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole decides that he needs to restore a forklift truck, while Simon O'Brien gets all zen with a stone water feature

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates the unclaimed estate of a Nottinghamshire woman, but are unsure of its value, and another search reveals the fascinating story of working life on Britain's waterways. Plus, details of more unclaimed windfalls

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers take on the challenging task of finding the heir to a £200,000 fortune, and unearth the story of a tragic accident on the London, Midland and Scottish Railways in the process. Plus, a surprising family secret is uncovered in a case that took a team almost 20 years to solve

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Spain, where Ben Eyre and Anna Chalu are first to host at Vista Del Torcal in the Andalusian Mountains. Despite being impressed with their rooms, some guests are less enthused by an afternoon of rock climbing, leaving Ben and Anna hoping a full English breakfast will save their bacon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jed and Mandy Filmer welcome their rivals to the Hotel la Tartana on Spain's Costa Tropical, and hope to impress them with a cookery class - not realising one of their guests is a qualified chef. A revelation at dinner stuns the group, before the Filmers' attitude to breakfast service jeopardises their chances of victory

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julia Grant hosts the third round of the competition in Spain at her Benidorm B&B The Queens Hotel. Her guests are not impressed with her standards of cleanliness, finding dirt, dust and hairs, and tensions rise at dinner over her 'straight-friendly' label. The owner improves the evening by giving everyone a drag makeover and persuading them to perform in a revue, but some of the feedback she receives leaves her enraged

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final hosts in Spain are Alastair Smith and Martyn Watson, owners of the gay and naturist-friendly Almond Tree Villa in Murcia. The day's activity is olive picking, but the mood turns sour when Jed admits he gave Julia's hotel low marks, while a disaster in the bathroom and a sugar-rich continental breakfast reflect badly on Alastair and Martyn's feedback scores

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants of the Spanish special meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Keepers introduce a new male to the spotty chocolate poison dart frog colony, hoping that the competition will result in an increase in tadpoles. Meanwhile, the Sulawesi macaques are ecstatic to welcome a new baby to their family, but their enthusiasm is a cause for concern as new mother Maggie may not be able to protect her baby from the other females

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Amrita comes to the shelter looking for a furry friend but gets more trouble than she bargained for with Oreo the Jack Russell cross. The Murphy family are bowled over by Louey and Pippi

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows an ambitious build in Cornwall, as Leigh and Richard transform a derelict 17th-century flour mill into a contemporary, three-bedroom home. They employ traditional craftsmen to start work on restoring the exterior, but it's not long before the true scale of the damage to the structure is revealed, and as the costs rise, they are forced to take on more of the work themselves

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Keith arrives with a fast heart rate and while staff urgently try to bring it down his wife talks about raising deaf children and being diagnosed with the 'deaf gene'

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to two serious road traffic collisions, while on the west bank of Loch Lomond, a minibus carrying 15 tourists has collided with a car. In South Ayrshire, an 86-year-old grandmother is struggling to breathe after a high-speed crash, and 72-year-old William has a severe cut to his arm after an attempt to chop wood with a circular saw went horrifically wrong

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Jacqui must act fast when severely underweight baby Jaziah is rushed into resus with breathing difficulties. In paediatric A&E, it is hoped that 18-month-old Charlie's urine test results will explain why he has been feeling unwell for five days, while 81-year-old Ronald prepares for a CT scan after suffering a suspected stroke that is affecting his speech

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

Danni Menzies has five great properties lined up for her £170,000 budget, but will any be the oasis of calm that she has her heart set on?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The detectives search for the relatives of a well-liked Essex woman without knowing the value of her estate, and hope that their gamble will pay off when the amount is revealed . programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tim and Jules Anderson are first to host at the King's Head and Queen's Jules in Suffolk, where they provide their guests with a lesson in how to fillet fish, and an evening of karaoke. However, the owners find criticism hard to take the following morning

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: The story of the RAF's 1982 mission to bomb Port Stanley's runway using a single Vulcan aircraft, thus making the island inaccessible to Argentine jets. Told through first-hand accounts, the long-range bombing is recalled, detailing how the crew was forced to employ obsolete skills and scavenge for crucial spare parts in scrapyards to prepare the plane for the task, which was fraught with setbacks and danger from the outset

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Tino is rushed into resus with memory problems after slumping over her desk at school. A woman with a history of anxiety attacks requires a scan after being brought in suffering from numbness down her left side, and an 11-year-old boy is treated for a broken leg after being knocked down by a car

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent from Kamloops to the spa resort of Banff. This magnificent journey takes him to the highest point of the 19th century transcontinental Canadian Pacific Railway line at Kicking Horse Pass, past Lake Louise and inside spiral tunnels blasted through the mountains. Along the way, Michael hears of the harsh and dangerous conditions endured by the Chinese and European labourers who built the railway, and looks back at the historic driving of the Last Spike, which completed the Canadian Pacific Railway in 1885

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the conclusion of his two-part journey, Simon investigates the environmental challenges facing Cornwall and the rest of the country. He discovers how the region's farmers are adopting new, less intensive approaches that are both more profitable and environmentally friendly, and reveals how reintroducing beavers to the uplands could tackle the problem of widespread flooding. He also encounters some of the county's iconic wildlife, including grey seals that live in constant risk of getting caught up in discarded fishing nets

The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer tracks down some of the most endangered animals on the planet in their natural habitats, starting with orangutans in the rainforests of Borneo. Deforestation and poaching have halved the apes' population in the last 60 years, and they're in serious danger of becoming extinct. In the company of indigenous guides and naturalists, he gets a better understanding of how they are surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Maine Coon cat is brought into the practice with a fractured hip joint, which Noel determines is caused by a genetic disease that has made the heads of both of her femur bones degenerate. After a very challenging process of weighing up the pros and cons of surgery, the owners opt for bilateral total hip replacement.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Memorable moments of the year, featuring some of the country's favourite celebrities critiquing TV shows that they have watched. The line-up of famous faces includes Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, Gyles Brandreth and Maureen Lipman, Lorraine Kelly and her daughter Rosie, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Tom Jones and Anne-Marie, and Shaun Ryder and Bez. Shows appraised include Masked Dancer, First Dates, Quizness, The Handmaid's Tale, Secret Crush, Extreme Sisters, Sex/Life and Celebrity Karaoke Club

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The Drone Unit follows a passenger fleeing from a hit and run, leaving the driver to face the music. Two high risk football matches are put under drone surveillance as rival fans threaten to cause mayhem on the streets of Wolverhampton. The unit is deployed to a park in the early hours when a 999 call reports a group of people trying to bury a body

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Wilderness survival challenge in which 11 people must battle the elements in the remote wilderness of northwest Canada, equipped with only a handful of basic tools to win £100,000. At the start of the journey, they face the first signs of bears and wolves, and race to put up shelters and light fires before the sun sets, leaving them in the pitch-black night with only the sounds of the wilderness for company

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to reports of a man collapsed in the street and in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, he's surrounded by police officers who've been carrying out CPR. In other cases, a woman in severe abdominal pain has a panic attack as the paramedics try to get her breathing under control, while a man with a fast heart rate is vomiting blood

programme.title: A Cotswold Farmshop
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the family-run Gloucester Service Station in the Cotswolds. This first episode visits the only cheesemaker in the world who uses milk from Gloucester rare-breed cows. Farm shop buyer Alex visits the farm to try out Jonathan's new flavoured cheese, and also to see if he would let them stock his rare-breed beef. This episode also explores Gloucester Services' close association with the local community

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals arrive at the Domo Boutique Hotel in Oldbury near Birmingham, where owner Ali expects his luxury lodgings to wow his fellow competitors. Helen and Lauren are dazzled by the decor, but a caffeine conundrum leads to some trouble brewing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT manager Bea is the first to host in Gloucestershire, hoping an international menu inspired by her travels will impress her guests and set her on the way to winning the prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wine connoisseur Adam hosts the second evening in Gloucestershire, but he has a challenge on his hands with rowdy guests and his dessert falling foul of a custard catastrophe

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cycling enthusiast Steve hosts the third dinner party of the week in Gloucestershire, hoping to impress his guests with a menu inspired by his travels

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-four Lisa hopes a back-to-basics menu and an evening of entertainment will ensure her the £1,000 - only for an interpretive dance challenge to catch her guests off-guard

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with a pair of B&B hosts in France as they open an onsite restaurant and two Buckinghamshire scuba divers in Spain who are planning to expand their business

He would love to buy a place in the south-west of France, but she is nervous of taking the plunge and would prefer Devon - much closer to family and friends. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help with their property search

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Laura Hamilton help three generations of the same family who are on the move together. Father John is considering buying a property for their unusual requirements in the Colchester area of Essex, but his daughter Lucy has her heart set on the Algarve in Portugal where her partner comes from. Whatever they finally decide, there must be room for grandad as well

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon Garner and her son Shaun help Scunthorpe-based husband and wife Stephen and Linda Thompson find a spacious villa in Almeria for their budget of 200,000 euros. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Rechristened Bloodshot, Garrison wages top-secret war alongside other enhanced killing machines, while piecing together a conspiracy that robbed him of the woman he loved. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Eiza Gonzalez and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Alone

programme.desc: The guest house owners convene at the Crown Inn in Gayton, Norfolk, where owners Lisa and Neil Staples hope their historic setting and boutique-style rooms will garner praise.
